g.text: - lets you deploy any dockerfile or prebuilt container
- lets you deploy a node-js (should be any in future) application without a dockerfile with just a github repo
should be able to track and auto update based on branch or tag??? (tag is maybe stretch goal)
- exposes that container via a unique URL
Components to make this all work: (everything in go unless stated otherwise)
a) needs to watch for updates to a git repo
b) needs to call appropriate update service to update deploy
c) base our work on https://github.com/fluxcd/source-controller (wrap this maybe?)
3) Service that builds a container - n1t3h0und???
a) service that can build a container given a git repo
- does the git repo get attached to service, or does the service pull repo?
b) service needs to push the image to a container registry
- what registry? harbor is hard to deploy but is probably best eventually?
- https://goharbor.io/docs/2.8.0/install-config/ easy enough to set up ourselves? maybe?
c) needs to event when container is built (nats.io) (maybe stretch goal?)
e) only want to store last 3 container images (stretch goal)
a) take an image, run it in a customer namespace
b) update istio virtual service/gate to expose application
c) update app service with rout to new service
2) create istio network policies to limit namespace to itself
